Class Environment

    • Method Detail

      • getFlagMarker

        public java.lang.String getFlagMarker()
        Returns the sequence of characters that flags are prefixed with. For Example -- for such flags: --verbose.
        Returns:
        the sequence of characters that flags are prefixed with.

      • setFlagMarker

        public void setFlagMarker(java.lang.String flagMarker)
        Sets the sequence of characters that flags are prefixed with. For Example -- for such flags: --verbose.
        Parameters:
        flagMarker - The sequence of characters that flags are prefixed with.

      • getOptionMarker

        public java.lang.String getOptionMarker()
        Returns the sequence of characters that options are prefixed with. For Example - for such options: -infile foo.txt.
        Returns:
        the sequence of characters that options are prefixed with.

      • setOptionMarker

        public void setOptionMarker(java.lang.String optionMarker)
        Sets the sequence of characters that options are prefixed with. For Example - for such options: -infile foo.txt.
        Parameters:
        optionMarker - The sequence of characters that options are prefixed with.

      • getEscapeChar

        public char getEscapeChar()
        Returns the character used to escape other functional characters. On DOS/NT systems this is ^ by default, \ on UNIX-Systems.
        Returns:
        The character used to escape other functional characters.

      • setEscapeChar

        public void setEscapeChar(char escapeChar)
        Sets the character used to escape other functional characters.
        Parameters:
        escapeChar - The character used to escape other functional characters.
